Reviews.Title: “Not for smaller business events!”
Reviews.Author: ADM_BayArea
Reviews.Content: Let me start by acknowledging that the hotel is attractive and well maintained. To summarize, I would NOT recommend planning a small event at this hotel, especially when there is a larger event occurring, the service level suffers. I have no complaints about the hotel or meeting rooms, only felt that the service was sub-standard. The rest of the review will focus on the service issues I experienced which led me to that conclusion. 1) Beginning with my arrival--no parking, had to valet park because ALL THE WAY AROUND this massive building there were no parking spaces. (I later learned that there is a shared parking garage, but the signage wasn't apparent to me from where I entered.) 2) I arrived before the posted check-in time and they were not able to give me a room (the front desk attendant had a "so what" attitude, which bothered me much more than waiting for a room to be ready!) I gave my luggage to the bellman and went to the hotel restaurant. When I returned at 3:00 (check-in time) they STILL had difficulty assigning me a room and again with the attitude(different front desk attendant, same attitude.) 3) When I asked about obtaining my luggage, I was told "Oh, we don't have a bellman on duty." At check-in time?? When the hotel is clearly full of people? I had to go with a manager to the storage area, identify my own bags and "borrow" a luggage cart. 4)The next morning, our meeting was scheduled to start and we needed to make a last minute run across the freeway for computer speakers (A/V team only had full sound boards at a cost of $300+.) There was NO OTHER GUEST at the valet station and I asked if my car was nearby because I was in a hurry and would take a cab if that was the better option. The valet assured me, "it's right around the corner, we'll be right back." 15 minutes later, my business associate pulls in (to attend the meeting) and we take HER car because the valet still hadn't returned with my car. 5) No signage directing attendees to our smaller meeting--a number of our participants commented on parking problems and difficulty finding the room. I'm sure the experience of larger groups is very different, but for a smaller meeting (20 people) we paid a premium for less than ideal service.

Reviews.Title: “Would return if required”
Reviews.Author: LivetoTravelNicely
Reviews.Content: We recently completed a stay at the InterContinental Dallas for a convention+extended weekend visit. There were many features about this hotel that I liked, but in the end, there were several things that first brought it to a four rating, and then finally landing at the three rating that I have decided to bestow upon it. Comparing to its own hotel class (which is typically how we travel), I would rank it average, at best. Compared to all hotels, I might give it a four, but only because 3.5 or 3.75 aren't available options. The PROS: Staff were friendly and helpful each time Housekeeping was good Restaurant food was pretty good (this is the sit-down restaurant) Bed was comfortable; Sheets were 'ok' Good area of town, but at least a 5-10 minute walk to anything not at the hotel The CONS: Towels sucked...they were the tiny little white towels that I would expect at a motel. Further, they were very thin/worn and had multiple and noticable stains on them. Water pressure. I noticed this was mentioned in a recent post. It was "manageable" in the shower, but the toilet stool was kind of a problem. It took multiple flushes and it took a good 5 minutes for the tank to refill for the next flush. Outside entry doors next to the Starbucks. It had blue duct-tape on them covering some key holes. This is not acceptable for a classy hotel...get new doors. They can pay for them with the all of the profits from the Starbucks and gift shop. Cafe that sold Starbucks and gift shop. Way overpriced. I normally don't complain about prices because I know that hotels routinely up the price on everything. But, a small container of TUMS (8 tums in the roll) was $3.99 and a Snickers was $1.59, for example! Cafe that sold Starbucks. Old food. They had yogurt for sale that was 2 weeks over the expiration date. Not acceptable. This made me stay away from the sandwiches because if they are willing to sell two week past the date yogurt, how old are the sandwiches!? Channel selection on the TV sucked...that is unless you like Fox News and CNN or re-runs of old sitcoms. Besides local channels, you got Fox News, CNN, MSNBC, ESPN, TBS, TNT, and The Weather Channel. Also HBO. I'd rather have a broader selection of channels and no HBO. "Free HBO" is about a 20 year old marketing technique that worked, well about 20 years ago. Not such a hot amenity in 2012. (But that is a personal preference.) Air Conditioner wasn't keeping up, and we were there in March! I had the stupid thing on 65 but was sweating in bed on top of the covers. I didn't have a thermometer, but upon returning home, I had the A/C on 72 (and it is accurate) and I had to use a blanket...no sweating either at home....so it had to have been at least 78 or hotter in the room. General Thoughts: This hotel is a business hotel that caters to Conference Attendees. It is adequate for a few nights while at a conference. Further, if you are looking for a nice bed to sleep for a night or two and the other hotels in Dallas are full, I'd certainly stay at the InterContinental for that. Just remember my Pros, because they were absolutely Pros....great staff including housekeeping. Just an older building and a poorly run Coffee Shop.

Reviews.Title: “Shows its age; awful toilet flush; Concierge gave wrong information”
Reviews.Author: snod73
Reviews.Content: The property is located conveniently; Safe area; Rooms show their age; Pillows had nothing in them = neck pain Sheets gave us allergies. Bed was decent. Walls are paper thin. You can listen in on the next door conversation. The toilet flush was so weak.....it needed two flushes to get out a few sheets of toilet paper. So, you can imagine how many flushes were needed for one day!! The concierge lacks knowledge to provide recommendations for restaurants. He sent our group (of 8 people) to Chamberlain's fishmarket....when we clearly mentioned that 2 in our group were vegetarian. He swore that the restaurant had vegetarian dishes. Of course, the restaurant had nothing for the veggies and so the group split to two restaurants. No thanks to the concierge. This made for some very uncomfortable times during a big meeting. I would suggest that the concierge say "I dont know" if they dont know what they are talking about. Of course, our group was also to blame for listening to the concierge. Otherwise, nothing special about this property. Internet access is $10 per day. Which sucks....but this is common in full service properties.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service!”
Reviews.Author: skosmoski
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for my Beauti Control business. Sandy at the front desk had a positive attitude even with the rush of crazy ladies checking in! The location of this hotel is right off the largest strip of amazing places to eat know matter what you are hungry for you can find something! The beds and pillows are amazing! Having the option to print off my flight and booking information at the front desk was a nice option too!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 nights in Feb, Nice place to visit.”
Reviews.Author: EricandLeiza
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, beds comfy and shower had plenty of pressure. Good selection of beers on tap in the lougne with some that I had never seen before but am looking for again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat in the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: UKJohn88
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Feb 2012 on business. Arrived at about 6pm. Check in was quick and uneventful. Had a room on the 14th Floor with a nice view. Room was of a good size, the furnishings nice and comfortable. Wifi access cost $9.95 per day. Was feeling rather tired after a long flight so decided to eat in the restaurant. Big mistake. The service is really very very poor and slow. Ordered a drink and this didn't come. I had to remind the waiter about it. Ordered a steak and waited ages for it. Looked around and everyone was waiting for their food too. The waiters were no where to be seen. They would disappear out of sight leaving us with no service for long periods. It was as if the waiters were helping out in the kitchen??? Where else would they have gone? When the food eventually did come, it was cold. Had it been ready for some time just waiting for someone to bring it out? Will never eat there again. Poor service, very slow, cold food, expensive too. Experience in the restaurant affected my opinion of the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: T_R_Grant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights for work and have no complaints about the service or facilities. The rooms were comfortable and fairly well-appointed. The location was convenient for my needs, and there are several dining options nearby. It wasn't a particularly memorable hotel, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: dsingram
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the facilities first class... as you would expect. But you have to pay for too many things that should be included at this price point. Also the Wifi service did not work during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second Class Patron”
Reviews.Author: rbmccm
Reviews.Content: The rooms are run down and so is the Hotel. Outside their windows are mark with years of weathering and inside the hotel was outdated 1980â€™s motif. The staff, including the doormen, where all stuffed shirt who tried to make you feel as though you were a second class patrons if you missed a tip. The front desk folks, including the manager, just didn't get it. In the rooms (we had two) the furniture was scratched and the lamb shade was cracked. The bathtub flooded each time due to it being clogged. The toilet kept leaking and the overall fit of the room was just ok. No HD TV and limited channels. Maid service was good. The best part of our stay was the restaurant for breakfast! What a layout, second to none. Friday night was a Prime Rib buffet that was just fabulous! The wait staff was tripping over themselves trying to please us! Incredible! Overall, watch out you will regret this decision.

Reviews.Title: “Property is ancient and rooms are in terrible shape”
Reviews.Author: harry_Philly
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed at this hotel was because the meeting organizers had reserved rooms here. The property is old and rooms are badly in need of renovations. - The bed was not comfortable - The room reeked of cigarette smell, even though it was supposed to be non-smoking (when I told the front desk about it, they said may be air from smoking rooms was coming through the vents! They did noting to fix it or give me an alternate room.) - The front desk / concierges didn't even know where meeting rooms in their own hotel were! They had to consult with the bellhop to get that info. The only positives about the hotel were their meeting planners and catering. Both were of excellent quality and very prompt / helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going back!”
Reviews.Author: TheSteck
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully helpful staff, great lobby and really good breakfast! Spacious Gym. Looking forward to the refurb and will be back to give 5 stars very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another hotel upgrading”
Reviews.Author: OutsideNycStevie
Reviews.Content: As a business hotel that is accessible, can accommodate a large group and is located close to many restaurant options, I would say this is a decent spot. Ultimately, after they have gone through their extensive renovation, it will be very good. Wonderful staff makes up for the minimal dining choices inside. It was a good value and very adequate for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with good amenities. I had a short business stay and had no problems. Quality rooms and staffing. Decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Naper2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night on January 12. The service was excellent. The room was very nice and spacious. The bathroom had a large sink area and a lighted make-up mirror which I always appreciate. Room service was prompt and very good. The lobby bar has very good food. I would stay here again when visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: alibarbaraMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days over the christmas break. We were really only here to sleep, so it didn't matter that the place was like a ghost town until New Year's Eve. If you have the ambassador card, it is pretty useless here because they are redoing the 16th floor where you would normally enjoy extra amenities. We were on the 11th floor and beds were comfortable. The rooms were kept very clean in spite of us having a 6 year old who left goldfish all over. We ordered room service a few times and it was OK- nothing special but they were happy to accommodate. We tried to use the Starbucks in the lobby but it seems to be hit or miss as to whether they open for the day. We bought coffee in the hotel restaurant and it was pricey and not as good as other places. If you have a car, there are loads of places to eat and find breakfast that are much cheaper. You can even walk to Cafe Brazil which turned out to be our favorite on this stay. There was a coffee pot in the room but no microwave. The refrigerator is locked but contains high price snacks. The Sunday brunch seemed very expensive so we didn't eat there. There is wifi in the lobby, but not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lucygoosey1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May of 2011. Great experience start to finish. Was there for business for the week. Room was very nice - lots of space, good amenities. Blow dryer, work desk,iron, etc all in the room. Good room service menu as well. Only downside to rooms was there was no WIFI when I was there. You could access it in the lobby but not in your rooms. Two restaurants on site - starbucks coffee shop in morning was great. A nice touch to stop for coffee on your way out the door. Hotel was close to some great shopping as well. If you are a shopper, you have to go to the Galleria. Great shopping and the hotel shuttle will take you and pick you up. All in all,a great experience and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No as good as I thought”
Reviews.Author: obdo2002
Reviews.Content: First, my first issue was the 1-877 number that I have contacted with to confirm my reservation. The lady I spoke to was not friendly. And she kept asking me to spell my name for more than 3 times. She got an accent and was kind of rude. I felt bad after talking to her. Second, I checked in for 2 nights. The first night, there were no ropes and slippers in our room. The front desk sent us the ropes after we asking for them, but the slippers were out. The next day, the slippers were still out. The carpet was kind of dirty with some stain. The floor was cold to have my bare foot on it. And no slippers?! The room had no fridge and the TV reception was not too good. I thought they should offer some HD program or local channels that are HD, but just couldn't find any. I feel somewhat disappointed staying there and I might not stay in the hotel chain for my trip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: pillz
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed here. As an Ambassador I was upgraded from a king premier to a two-level club suite which was fabulous. In addition I was offered free wi-fi, a movie, and breakfast. The staff was very friendly. Check-in and check-out were very efficient. Addison airport is nearby and is home to the Cavanaugh Flight Museum. The Galleria mall is a short drive away. There are many restaurant nearby. Just remember tollways in Dallas are cashless. So if you have a rental car, you may consider getting a Pass24 for $10/day or avoid toll roads all together.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Dallas Burbs”
Reviews.Author: Jakuch
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Dallas is in Addison, about 25 minutes away from the airport. I was there for a conference. The rooms are good and spacious. I was in a suite but when I arrived the bed wasn't made, and though there were two rooms, the sliding doors to the patio weren't my idea of secure. The patio itself overlooks a tarpaper roof. I asked to be moved to a regular room and was immediately moved to the club level with apologies. The bed was very comfortable and they get extra points for having excellent bathroom lighting. The staff was helpful, with the exception of the person who ran the gift shop. She seems to be from the planet Unhappy. The conference facilities were very nice and extremely convenient to the rooms. The elevator is about ten yards from the conference rooms. The conference staff also made sure our group was well looked after. The food was okay, but nothing special, but that may be a function of my taste as well. I really enjoyed the lounge bar -- it was relaxing but upscale, with muted tones and sleek finishes with very comfortable oversized seating. I had the tuna tartar one night which was to die for and some very excellent duck tacos the next.The hotel itself is showing its age a little bit but the hotel itself was very clean and spiffed up. Overall, a very decent place.

Reviews.Title: “No WiFi, No Real Fridge, No Microwave, Bad Starbucks”
Reviews.Author: JohnKurtz
Reviews.Content: This is a business class hotel, not a family friendly one. It had a generally classy appearance. But you have to pay for anything extra, including WiFi! I think the staff is supposed to provide free WiFi to Priority Club Gold Members though (but he did not). My wife said that the room was not very clean. The beds were double beds, so my son's feet were on my back all night. There was no microwave. I had to get a key to use the snack fridge in the room, which only had enough room left for a little container amid all of the hotel snacks. The bathroom soaked up like a sauna room after a shower. There was no indoor pool. The breakfast menu looked like it may have cost about as much as a steak dinner, but I did not look that carefully. We drove down the road and got a donut. The location is in the city part of North Dallas and is somewhat convenient to a lot of things. This is a business class hotel. It is either for the very wealthy or for folks whose business is paying the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great, great perks!”
Reviews.Author: AVSENT
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business and was amazed at how the staff made me feel at home. First, I received an upgrade for being an ambassador member; but I did not expect to get the Kibuki suite. It was a great room on two levels; a nice seating area on the first level, and a full suite on the second (large living area and king bed). There was a bath on each level. The room was very spacious like the hotel. The main level of the hotel had high ceilings and marble floors, giving it a very grand feeling. Then, I received a free drinks and appetizer coupon for the lobby bar. There was a nice ambience with the bar adjoining the large lobby sitting area. I had the Kobe beef sliders, very nice washing them down with a couple of Stella's. They don't have an airport shuttle, but the van does local runs including the Galleria mall. I had chinese buffet and sushi at the food court. There was barely room for the sliders. But, to top it off, they sent the complimentary fruit and candy to the room (ambassador perk) after all this. I was stuffed. I didn't get to check much else out as time was limited. But, this was a very clean, grand, and hospitable ITC property. The staff from the desk, bar, and porters/van drivers were all attentive. Kudos to the great team work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cawmessas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel November 6th and truly enjoyed our stay. Beds are very comfotable and service was good. My only complaint was there weren't enough towels in the bathroom. We got this hotel for an amazing price on Priceline so it was certainly worth the price $45 night. The location is perfect- near wonderful shopping and not too far from the nightlife in Uptown and Downtown. I recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JonTx
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star hotel. Very average. Front desk staff is good. Beds had stain on sheets and mattress needed replacing. Also had stains on towel in the bathroom. An overhaul or at least some updating is needed. No wi if in the rooms which is very unusual these days. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Call me when they check-in to 2011”
Reviews.Author: Unsatisfied34678
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Intercontinental Dallas where youâ€™ll be greeted by a polished valet guy and another one right behind him drinking a soda, texting, and eating who ignores assisting my wife with our luggage. After opening the ridiculously outdated heavy doors (for my wife, remember the valet guy has his hands full) we entered the lobby. Though the entrance to the hotel was not so great, the lobby looked fantastic. Clean, good ambiance, busy bar. Our check-in was simple; the gentleman was very professional and made us laugh and smile. I didnâ€™t ask about internet connection at the time, but Iâ€™ll get into that in a bit. There was a crowd at the elevator at which two or three elevators were broken. After about fifteen minutes of waiting, we arrived at our room; it was tidy and clean thought the hallways carpet leading to it were dirty and stained. My wife wanted to switch on her iPad and video call our daughter to let her know we have arrived safely. This is where the nightmare begins. Let me inform you that our stay was for three nights, October of 2011. Two-Thousand-Eleven. This hotel has no in-room wifi. In fact no free internet anywhere. The in-room charge was $10 for a day, but if you disconnect your computer or turn it off, guess what, itâ€™s another ten dollars. Itâ€™s all wired, (Ethernet cable) ya know, the ones from the 80â€™s and 90â€™s.. so no iPad connection at all. I was able to get my phone to use as a hotspot, but thatâ€™s hardly convenient. Around dinner time we headed down to get some recommendations from the hotel concierge. Let me say this now, through out all the miseries of this outdated property, the concierge, Kural, was simply sunshine to my wife and I. He suggested amazing restaurants around the hotel every night of our stay and my wife spoke of him at our dinners excited to give him the feedback. He also made the arrangements for us to attend the State Fair. The State Fair was incredible, fun, and the food as well. Kural gave us information on how to get there using Dallasâ€™s bus and train system. From the hotel itâ€™s about 20 miles away, but round trip it was only $4. Talk about a man who knows how to find you a deal, this young man was just fantastic. We did eat breakfast once at the hotel, nothing special, but the service was good. We also sat down for drinks in the lounge / lobby. My wife and I waited for over 15 minutes to be served. We were surrounded by young people enjoying their night and drinks, but the waitress just seemed to ignore us and would rather chat with the other wait staff. After we were served our overflowing drinks we walked to the drive to use the hotel shuttle to Gloria's. We waited to be acknowledged staring at the same valet man hunched over his desk texting. The Shuttle is a great service, being hinted that we need to tip the driver (our texting friend) is not so classy. The shuttle was not so quick to pick us back up. When I questioned the driver he apologized and said the shuttle was being used to buy groceries for the gift shop. Groceries?! Are you kidding me? We were not the only ones delayed by a shopping run the hotel decided to do in the middle of what seemed to be a chaotic night for the shuttle. Talk about time management, I owned a restaurant in my days and all our food was delivered. And that was the 70's for god sakes. The day we departed our check out was quick and easy, no horrendous charges, and we like it that way. We did not utilize Room Service or have any problems with Housekeeping. We could have ended on a good note with just that, but no, this property cuts corners again. My wife and I ordered 2 cups of coffee from the Starbucks in the lobby, and paid for Starbucks coffee. I know coffee, I brew it now for a living. When I asked the cashier what it really was.. guess what, the house coffee is FOLGERS and they sell it as Starbucks. That is just plain embarrassing..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: helenmarie166
Reviews.Content: I was worried due to the negative reviews but I was very surprised at what a beautiful hotel this is and the excellent service we received from the staff. The room was upgraded and very clean and comfortable. The pictures do not show the remodeled rooms with beautiful decor, flat screen television and a very comfortable king-size bed. It is in a very convenient location with many restaurants/malls nearby. Check in & out was a breeze and I experienced no problems at all during my 3 night stay. The room was cleaned every day and I enjoyed coming here to relax and rest after each day. Couldn't have asked for more looking forward to staying here again in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was Very Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: tripjubu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at IC Dallas for 4 nights during a business convention in Oct 2011 and a Dallas Cowboys game. The design, appearance and general look and feel of the interior is modern and appealing. It was a nice place to stay. But, as a business traveler, I think the ball is dropped in a few areas. 1) No Free WiFi. I travel a lot with my laptop and rarely have trouble connecting. At IC Dallas, the room connection for internet is not free, and it's a hard wired setup that you have to plug in. Mine didn't work. I spent 15 minutes on the phone with the support line. They told me to ask for a new cable cord. I did, Still didn't work. Finally, they replaced the power supply for the modem and that did the trick. Internet was fast and reliable thereafter for the duration. But that still left just a wired connection, so use of the laptop was restricted sitting at the desk and staying plugged in. That's ok for me, but if you like sitting in a chair or on the bed with your laptop, you'll not be able to do so. No free WiFi in the lobby either, I was told. This isn't important to everyone, but if you're like me, it is. I like to get out of the room sometimes, and get some work done in a less confined space and I appreciate having the option of grabbing a table in a coffee shop downstairs, or in the lobby area. Can't do that at IC. 2) Isolated location. Way up the freeway in Addison. There are a couple of chain restaurants within a 10 minute walk, but otherwise, during my stay in Dallas, I had to drive anywhere I wanted to go when not doing convention stuff in the hotel, and traffic sucked. I would not use this as a "home base" for an extended trip or vacation to Dallas visit but would instead find something downtown with walkable entertainment and dining options so you can leave the vehicle parked if you'd prefer. Those were my main two gripes. I didn't use room service, maid service or any of facilities other than the room, restaurant and convention happenings. The convention workshop rooms were too small. That's the fault of my organization for not planning better for the attendance, but the rooms were not expandable and we had overflow capacity. The lounge is a cool place to hang out with friends and relax. The breakfast buffet was ok, not spectacular, but good enough. If you are a Priority Club member, you'll get some perks. I was given free breakfast every morning, a $20 buffet each day, was was ok for free but I would not have paid $20 to eat there otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences I have had in a long time! The rooms were cold and the service was slow to non-existent! If I have to pay for a 4-Star Hotel, it would be nice to get 4-Star quality rather than 1-2 Star quality. I was there for a conference and we had to wear jackets and coats as the conference rooms as well as individual rooms were far to cold. If anyone is looking for an ideal conference facility, please look elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: j_andy09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, and our room was quiet. There was a wedding downstairs and when we got back to our room after midnight, it was still going on in the diner/lobby area. As soon as we got into the elevator, we could not hear the music (which they were playing fairly loud), nor could we hear it in our room. The next morning when we left there were cleaning ladies at the room directly across from ours, and even standing at the door inside our room we couldn't hear them. It was very refreshing to not hear every noise in the hallway. The decor of the room was very modern. It had a very comfortable bed, with high quality, soft sheets and several pillows of different firmness to choose from. There were lamps on both sides of the bed, with electric outlets at the base of the lamps, so we could charge cellphones overnight where we could reach them if needed. The only bad thing was the hand towel they hung in our bathroom was not clean. It had make-up stains on the front of it, where it would have been seen when they put it up. The hotel iteself is convenient to an extensive selection of food, shopping and nightlife. Since it is on a major highway, walking is out of the question, but it didn't take us longer than 5 minutes to get anywhere we wanted to go. All in all, this is a wonderful hotel in a great location and I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No Wireless Internet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A J L
Reviews.Content: Really!?!? How can you be a 3.5- 4 star hotel and not have wireless Internet!?!?!? You can't. The furniture in the room looked to pretty old. The staff and service was friendly and helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the better InterContinentals”
Reviews.Author: nkTraveler01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at InterContinental hotels before in other cities and this one was sub-par compared to the reputation of InterContinental hotels. First the building itself is an older building. They have updated the rooms so they were decorated nicely. However, the windows were filthy. All you saw was dirt when you looked outside. The pillows were too large and stiff. My neck hurt after sleeping on them. Also, bathroom hooks were missing (there were nail holes on the door and walls) and there was a strange odor to the rooms and hallways. The lobby area was nice but also looked out-dated despite some of the renovations. They did have a very nice, relaxing lobby bar however the service was nonexistent. Twice we tried to order drinks/food from the waitress. Each time she said she'd be right back. Half an hour later, we ended up having to get up and order directly from the bar. The waitress never did come by our table. The pool was nothing spectacular. I've seen nicer pools in people's backyards. I know some people commented otherwise but I received some of the worst service I've ever had at this hotel. First, someone had left us a package at the front desk. We were willing to go pick it up but the person at the front desk nicely assured us that they would be able to deliver it to our room. An hour later, no package. When we called, they just rudely said they'll get it to us when they can. Later when we were checking out, we asked for a bellhop to send a cart since we had a lot of luggage. Again, nearly half an hour later (and with a plane to catch), there was still no bellhop or cart. We ended up lugging everything (with an infant child) by ourselves. Then as we are loading everything in our car, we were struggling a bit with all of our luggage and were taking several minutes longer than usual for loading. One of the staff rudely came to us and said this area was for loading/unloading only as my husband was actively trying to get a suitcase into the trunk. There were no other cars there and no cars were waiting for our spot so we didn't know what the issue was. We pointed and said we are loading and she only replied, please hurry. She didn't even bother to offer assistance. We stayed at this hotel because of a wedding held there. But I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Pat yourselves on the back!”
Reviews.Author: neilg23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions, always on business, the service and the management team are doing a great job. Somehow they have managed to motavate and endear the staff with a posoitive, friendly and helpful manner. Special mention to the concierge manager and his team, best I have come across!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and decent”
Reviews.Author: ngck2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for about 4 days. Rooms were spacious, clean and generally comfortable. Service at the front desk was efficient and friendly. The restaurant served a decent menu that gave value for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Not too fancy”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: I booked 10 days through Hotwire in April 2011. The property is alright. I did not like the pool too much but it's only me. The pool is close to a parking and I personally don't like it. The staff members are great. There is a great bar in the lobby. The hotel provides a free shuttle service to the mall nearby. You call when you are done and they pick you up free of charge. I stayed with the wifey and the 2 kids. No problem. If you like to be in the centre of everything, don't book there though or make sure you rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: deegoines
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I recently stayed at this hotel to celebrate our 2 year anniversary and her birthday. Everything was excellent. The hotel staff was amazing. Although the buffet is $20/person, the food is worth it. The complimentary shuttle travels a 3 mile radius which is very helpful. I recommend this hotel hands down!

Reviews.Title: “It was O.K. but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Joann0047
Reviews.Content: Outside care of hotel is not 4-star quality. Always, a bit noisey in the rooms. Always huge groups of people in the hotel. Seems over-booked in some regards. Not restful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hippychick925
Reviews.Content: We got our room on priceline for a very cheap rate, so I can't complain about that. I have to say I have been disappointed with our room. AC will not cool room. Shower has absolutely no water pressure. Towels are limp & dingy & threadbare. Mattress is hard & pillows are lumpy. We slept in, so maid service skipped us. We left hotel by 10:30 am. I've never stayed at a hotel that didn't come back & make the room up. We got back this evening & had clean towels (which I requested) but the dirty ones were still piled on the floor! Bed was not made either! Wow. I would NOT classify this as a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! We know we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: cindy s
Reviews.Content: 35th anniversary weekend brought us to this hote. It was roomy, beautiful, plenty of elevators so we didn't have to wait more than a few seconds.Fitness center had everything including fresh fruit and cooled bottled water, both making a huge difference in our being able to stay longer. Extra bonus to me was the sauna. The whole experience was wonderful. No Internet meant we relaxed, not work. The bed and pillows were super comfortable, the linens so pleasant that I just didn't want to get out of bed one day. We kept going back to sleep, enjoying the peace and comfort. We took our own noise maker fan so we didn't hear all the hall noises. We did hear the alarm in the adjoining room but were able to go back to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: JBones77
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from an Interncontinental since I have stayed a bunch around the country. The floors and rooms smelled old (almost like mothballs). The rooms were in decent shape, but nothing I would consider above average. I would suspect nicer places are available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Snailkite
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk went "above and beyond" what one would expect, helping us to get set up for our booth and making sure that the best rooms possible were available to us. The woman who checked us in (an Argentinian) went so far as to hold our keys for us as we waited for an early check in, and kept us informed when our rooms were ready. This allowed us to set up our booth and gave us ample time to rest in our rooms before our presentations began.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and out of date.”
Reviews.Author: mbvd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days on a business trip. The positives: Food was great. I ate all my meals at the conference I was at in the hotel. Very good - excellent actually. The lobby was very pretty. The negatives: The room - I have stayed in nicer at much cheaper hotels. The TV was ancient. No wifi. Furniture was old and tired. The location. Couldn't really walk anywhere. Would be a great place to be trapped for a conference if they made some updates to the rooms. Otherwise, this is a tired, old, and out of date hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, getting a little dated though....”
Reviews.Author: Newmanhwdfl
Reviews.Content: I had a recent stay here. The hotel was fine, it did not strike me as a 4 star hotel though. The room was VERY dark and bathroom getting kind of dated. The view was overlooking the area where they do conferences so the natural light was minimal and the most annoying aspect....there are no light switches for the lights besides bathroom and foyer. I had to turn each lamp on and off manually. I know it sounds petty but it was a pain in the rear. In short, for an inter continental pedigree.....I was expecting a little higher end, but more than adequate. I still get annoyed at nice hotels charging for wifi......BUT they do offer self park for free which is a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “I've NEVER had an issue with the Intercontinental Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Tambascio
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice before and will stay there again next weekend. My rooms there, and I book four at a time, have always been immaculate. The staff is friendly and helpful. No wifi! Give me a break! If you don't have mobile 3G for your devices then your behind the times. There's wifi at the Lobby level and it's free. No the restaurant is not 5 star, but then your not paying 5 star prices. It's perfectly fine for a meal if you can't get out. And with the FREE shuttle service and the multitude of restaurants in the area nitpicking the on site restaurant is stupid. I love this Hotel!!! For the price and location it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Worth coming back, but not quite 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler2348
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the Addison fireworks spectacular - within walking distance to the Kaboom Town festival over the 4th of July weekend. There was a special hotel rate which was a great deal. The lobby and common areas are quite elegant. Service is professional and courteous. Pros - (1) Great location (2) Rooms on top floors are elegant, spacious, flat screen TVs, bathrooms have been refinished with plenty of countertop space, excellent orange spice soap (3) Nice central bar with good DJ (4) Nice pool Cons - (1) The health club in the basement is nice, with spacious locker room and sauna, but the air flow was weak, even with several ceiling fans. A good health club should always have excellent ventilation, but this was subpar. Also, there was no drinking water anywhere. There was an empty water bottle fridge, and trying to find a water fountain or a bottle of water took some effort. The check-in counter apologized and said they would have housekeeping refill the water bottles, but the next day the mini fridge was missing altogether and I had to again go through some hoops to find drinking water during my 45 minute workout. So service wasn't quite up to par for what I expect in a 4-star establishment. (2) Internet is still wired. I understand Wifi is in the works, but for a 4-star establishment that is primarily a business hotel, this should've happened years ago. (3) For some reason the air seemed quite humid throughout the hotel, especially in our hotel room, and even with the A/C on full blast. The A/C did work and the room did cool off, but there was always a "damp" feeling that gave the air a stuffy feel. If I was staying there any longer I'd feel the need to purchase a dehumidifier. Overall, an excellent establishment that I would stay at again, but just short of a true 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again because of this problem”
Reviews.Author: OKCGal63
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love it. I read the reviews here and they were poor. BUT, those problems were fixed. I had a nice room on the 11th floor, and it was evidently a remodeled room, and had a lovely large flat screen TV. However, they had a terrible problem with their linens. I took a shower after the hot day, grabbed a bath towel and it had a large, black, what looked like mascara stain on it. Yuck. Grabbed another one. Another stain - not as big, but still gross. I toweled myself off with a hand towel, and called the front desk. They sent new towels up and said they had been checked. Fine. Later, i go to bed, and find the same type of stains on three out of four of the pillows. I took a picture of one of them - attached here. Wish I had taken one of the towel which was similar. Too tired to complain now, called in the morning. I did call, the manager wasn't in yet, and at 9 AM I spoke to her, camera in hand. I expressed my displeasure and she agreed. Supposedly there's a problem with their machine - if that's the case, they need to fix it asap. Because I had paid with priceline, they couldn't refund my money (really?) but they comped two room service bills. Bottom line - this is a very nice hotel, and this type of problem is unacceptable - period. I would not stay there again. My biggest requirement of a hotel is that it be clean - and 5 separate pieces of linens being stained is NOT clean. I think my stay should have been comped or a better remedy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: ViviAnne18
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lobby is beautiful and elegant. The location of the hotel is convenient, surrounded by such diversity and options of places to eat. The staff from front desk, room service and concierge was extremely helpful, patient and pleasant. I would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good value all things considered”
Reviews.Author: mergansertx
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: in North Dallas and easiest way to get there was via toll road. ROOMS: Very good: well appointed. confortable, good size. FOOD: Would not recommend the resturant. Pehaps they had a couple of bad days but the dinner their was only fair. Breakfast was OK. VALUE FOR MONEY: Good given I didn't book through the hotel but an online service.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better”
Reviews.Author: biffbulkie
Reviews.Content: Not horrible, but certainly not worthy of the Intercontinental name. Lobby is creepy and outdated, exterior as well. Restaurant food was subpar but on a good note, there are tons of places to eat in the neighborhood. Location is great. Room seems to have been one that has been renovated and was fine, although odd to see the bathroom lighting fixtures have rust on them already. Lack of in room wifi is unacceptable in this day and age however. Staff was competent if unenthusiastic.

Reviews.Title: “need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: jeff60856
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a top floor suite thought we would be getting a good looking room but the room was out dated nice view of the city but not worth the price box t.v up staires in bed room and flat screen in down stairs living room also the staff was nice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: 12persons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than a mile from the galleria mall . The hotel provides a free shuttle to the galleria as well as many restaurants near the hotel.......which is great for a girls night out when you don't want to have to pay for a cab. The rooms were nice, but not 4 star. The rooms did not have WiFi only a connection via a land line and the TVs in the rooms were the old bulky ones. To be 4 star I expect WiFi and High Def TV. The bathrooms were recently updated with granite and new fixtures. The beds were very comfortable with a down pillowtop mattress and big fluffy pillows. The staff was extremely helpful and very entertaining. My advice would be to try and find a deal on this hotel via other travel websites because I would not pay regular price for this hotel room.The best thing about this hotel is the location and the friendly hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of "intercon" brand - don't expect multistar from this property”
Reviews.Author: travelz4biz
Reviews.Content: were do i start -- --no wireless internet ... that means no ipad, ipod, iwhatever and your bounf to your desk with ur laptop--- wakeup mgmt its the 21 century.... --executive floor ... ha what a joke the super 8 breakfast is better ... again missed opportunity by the mgmt to take go that extra intercon mile --the food ... terrible no words describe terrible including the "fake" starbucks...yes a store that call it self starbucks and brews horrid coffee. ... good service there and decent goodies but cafe was not starbucks quality ---should i go on ... no simply put the management has missed capitalizing on what is potentially a great location... don't be fooled by the lobby pictures ... i had a hard lumpy bed layered with a foam/feather liner to give it some extra years and my old tube tv never cooperated with my remote...in my executive floor room ...i have to say the workers tried hard with what they had .. cleaning ladies were great,

Reviews.Title: “Awful, not very friendly to Newlyweds”
Reviews.Author: DwightW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights after our wedding before heading out to our honeymoon. We requested a King Premier room but when we got to the room we saw it had two tiny little beds. Called the front desk and they said they didn't have a King room and we'd have to wait. The parking lot seemed empty and the hotel didn't seem all that busy so I wonder why they didn't have the proper room we had paid for. After a few hours we had to check back, the desk didn't call us and then they had a king bed available. The room was not very nice. Sheets and pillows were cheap materials and very worn. Definitely NOT what I would expect from an alleged 4 star hotel. The start of our stay actually ruined the mood for the rest of it. Screwing up our room followed by uninterested service from the front desk made us feel like we weren't wanted. Here's a tip to the hotel staff and management: When a married couple checks in, give them the King Bed Rooms, not your pathetic tiny bed rooms!!!!! And no Wifi in 2011??? That's stupid! Gosh! You'd think they'd have that much common sense! The room was also noisy -- elevators, construction, thin walls. We ordered room service several times. The food was decent and delivery was as expected. But sadly, that's the only positive comment I can make on this hotel. WAY TO RUIN THE MOOD INTERCONTINENTAL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- suitable for Large Conventions-Do not opt for club access”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 3 Intercons in the last few months- Chicago (ORD), Atlanta (Buckhead) and this one in Dallas. Dallas is the least impressive of all these. The rooms are average, the parking is free but can be challenging to find if busy. The club level or concierge level is not worth it at all- at this Dallas location. Possibly the Buckhead location spoiled me and set expectations to high- but simply some fruit and coffee in the morning is not enough to charge what they do for this service. The staff, for the most part (not all) are very helpful and knowledgeable. Overall this was a satisfactory experience- no major complaints and nothing that would draw me back in 2 months on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for Magical Customer Service Moment!”
Reviews.Author: DAAustin
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a moment from my incredibly busy schedule to thank the management fom The InterContinental Hotel Dallas. My company spent several nights at this hotel during an event recently. And while the rooms, accommodations, bar and general hotel were as expected (absoutely TOP NOTCH), what was most impressive and the reason for my post, was the amazing customer service provided by management. I especially want to mention the Assistant General Manager Aref. A situation arose that the hotel did not have any control over...yet, he took customer service to the next level and created a magical customer service moment. I was so impressed with his diligence and promptness that I am now taking the time to thank him and the hotel...and will go out of my way to refer others to stay at this hotel and stay there myself again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Just made you feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: whisky102
Reviews.Content: We were in town for 1 night and hosted a show in the Intercontinental Dallas Ballroom. Being that this was the first time we had used the venue nobody knew what to expect......It could have been better. all the Ballroom staff was great! Herman, Alfonso, and Mike made sure that everything was smooth and attended to our every need. The ffod was to die for. The mash potato bar was unreal. We will definitely be hosting events at the Intercontinental Dallas in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: ICNNCI
Reviews.Content: Had to stay a few nights for business. Pillowcases were stained with penmarks, brownish-unidentifiable marks, black scuff marks like someone stepped on them. Sheets and towels were so thin they felt like gauze. The light-blocking curtains don't draw all the way making sleep past 7 am impossible. Asked for a quiet room but got one right next to the elevator. Food was ok. They had some kind of computer upgrade going on when I checked out and could not give me a receipt right away. An itemized receipt was to be emailed to me, but 3 days later nothing from the hotel. Location is good, right on the Dallas tollway & beltline.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, wifi sorely needed.”
Reviews.Author: collierje
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel, and having a Starbucks downstairs was fantastic. The staff was also very friendly, and the valets were excellent. My main problem was having to be attached to the desk for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Not great, but Ok.”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityCampbells
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to my meeting location, so I felt lucky to stay there...but I wouldn't stay there again. First, no wifi, which means you have to sit at the big imposing desk to plug in your computer, and you can't see the TV. Sure, the TV swivels, but not enough so that you can view it from the desk. The room service menu is limited, and although they'll tell you "25 to 30 minutes" that means 55 minutes--at least it did for the entire week that I was there (the food was good though). They never provided a key to the mini bar, so snacking was out of the question. One day I returned to find a makeup bottle broken (Lancome--the expensive stuff!) with no explanation or apology. Even more strange, one day, around 4 pm, a houskeeper just entered my room unannounced. She was replacing a towel, and she apologized for walking in on me--but really? Just a weird experience--beautiful lobby and lounge, but the rest is a little off.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend Stay...”
Reviews.Author: CrystalG51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental this weekend, and I was very nervous on the trip out there due to all of the negative reviews on here. We arrived Friday night and were greeted by the doormen. They opened our doors and helped us with our luggage. They offered valet, but we decided to self park after we checked in. The lady at the counter was a bit short, but polite enough. We went to our room and loved it! The view was amazing! Yes, the TV is a tube TV, but does that really take away from the room? No. How much time do you plan on staying in your room to need a huge flat screen TV? The bed was very comfy and there were lots of pillows, which is a huge plus in my book. We were not familiar with the area, so when we decided to go out for dinner, we asked the doorman what he suggested. He gave us the names of some places he thought were good and also let us know that there was a complimentary shuttle that would take us anywhere that was within 3 miles. So we did not drive anywhere all weekend! We took the shuttle, which is not one of those big buses, it is actually a very nice suburban. They would take us and come back and pick us up whenever we called. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes. It was very convenient, and allowed for my husband and I to enjoy some drinks together! We loved our stay and will be returning...

Reviews.Title: “SNAFU, Situation Normal All Fouled Up”
Reviews.Author: DFWMidCities
Reviews.Content: You will read good and bad reviews on the Intercontinental Dallas Hotel just like other hotels. I really like reading reviews on TripAdvisor because it lets me see if managemt respionds to bad reviews by improving service or if they maintain good review trends. If I see all good reviews- I stay. If I see all bad- I avoid. The hard part is when you see good and bad. Anyway, I always read these kind of reviews and then decide if I want to roll the dice or not and sometimes I am lucky, sometimes not. In other words, take this review with a grain of salt. This is a bad review. -Reserved on-line and selected King Premiere room with Bed and Breakfast option for two (which was to include breakfast and drink coupons at bar) -Arrived hotel and checked in. Received hotel key and cheerful "Enjoy your stay". -"Excuse me" I say, "We also should have some coupons for breakfast?" -Clerk checks, apologizes profusely and gives me a card for breakfast for two. I forgot to ask for drink coupons. I must admit I am irritated that I had to point out her lapse. -Room is swell and comfortable. Club floor. Nice and competent Club hostess. All good. -Wake up next day and go to breakfast with my wife. -A few construction men working in the Monte Carlo restaurant and maybe 2 people dining. Hostess asks if we need a menu or buffet. We say buffet and she seats us. -Sit down and present our breakfast voucher card to the waitress. She hustles away and another lady (head waitress??) shows up and says this card is only good for the "cold stuff" on the buffet. I look at the card and she is indeed correct. I say we want the full buffet. Bless her heart she is speechless. About this time an air compressor rev's up to an ear splitting pitch as the workman are working on a wall or something. I am not kidding. -I walk to front desk and say I think I have the wrong card, clerk looks on computer, apologizes profusely, and gives me new card for full buffet. The hot stuff. -I walk back to restaurant, present my card and we are allowed to go to buffet. By this time, I'm not hungry so I drink coffee, read the paper and watch my wife eat. it's good she says so no problems with quality of food. -Get the bill for two full buffets at $38 marked down to zero with, of course, the tip line staring right at me. I tip $10 because it's not the fault of the workers, its the fault of the managers and their inept computer system.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews would have you believe.”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline and was a little nervous after reading the reviews, but we did not have any of the issues that others had. The rooms were nice, clean, and of a good size. The hotel itself is about a mile north of the Galleria and is located near a reasonably nice shopping and dining area on Belt Line Road. The only issues that we had were that the coffee shop was closed when we arrived in the early afternoon (apparently, due to illness), and that there was still some construction going on in lobby. However, neither of these issues were more than a slight inconvenience. Oh, and some reviewers had said that they had to pay for parking, though I expect that was in the parking structure and not in the main parking lot. We never paid for parking during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding or other event”
Reviews.Author: dragonflytx
Reviews.Content: Dont use this place. It sucks they promised you a lot then just takes your money. NEVER trust them even it is not worth it... My wedding reception was not as they promised. it was crap food was bad and to compensate,. they offer more me more bad food.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE SURPRISE”
Reviews.Author: GrapevineTXGirl
Reviews.Content: We were attending a New Year's party held at this hotel and signed up for the package that included the hotel room. After reading the reviews, we were a bit leery as what to expect. Our hotel room was quite lovely and very spacious. The bed and pillows were probably one of the most comfortable that I've ever had the pleasure to sleep on at a hotel. The towels were soft and fluffy which was another nice touch. While we did not turn on the TV, I was surprised to see that it was not a flat screen and commented that to my husband. We attended with another couple and their room was just as nice as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible for families with infants!”
Reviews.Author: Sort88
Reviews.Content: I requested a crib and about 20 minutes later the oldest wooden crib I've ever seen was wheeled in. I didn't let my baby sleep in it for fear that my baby might loose a finger in the gaps in the crib joints. The crib bumper also looked antique as was tied on with what looked like shoe string.

Reviews.Title: “Was not thrilled at all”
Reviews.Author: hatedluv
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Intercontinental was not a thrill. Checked in and the double beds in the room looked like a pair of twin beds out of a dollhouse. The room that I ended up staying in itself was not the ideal four star hotel. The heat in my room went out and when the front desk was notified it took the (technician) maintenance guy an hour to get to my room and when he finally got there I also told him that I was having issues with the hot water in the bathroom. He was very rude and took his dirty shoes and walked all over my shower towel that I had on the floor. If the hotel was to go thru a major renovation I think that would be a four star maybe even a five star hotel. I was truly not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: aikoaikoallday
Reviews.Content: I do quite a bit of business travel, and while this is not a four star hotel, it is not too bad. The rooms are clean and on the large side - bed and bedding were good/very good quality. Carpeting was clean and pretty new, towels were new and soft. Technology is really, really dated - phones, TV and lack of WiFi deperately need to be improved. Staff was courteous, bar area was good, and room services was OK and delivered on time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than recent reviews led me to expect”
Reviews.Author: robertglenmoore
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on a room through Priceline and then was horrified to find many recent horrible reviews here. While the hotel is undergoing renovations, I've found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, my room is lovely (newly renovated), room service was prompt and the two meals I ate were very good. At full price I'd probably be disappointed by at discount rates it's a steal in the current state seems to be a solid value once construction is complete. Negatives: The gym is closed for construction but the hotel is offering free access to a Gold's Gym a few blocks away, with free shuttle service to the gym as well (it's also a short walk). My biggest negative is the absence of wireless internet (wtf?) and the old CRT TV in the room. If those are not temporary conditions of construction, then this place deserves to go bankrupt.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff held back by aging property...”
Reviews.Author: uttrekr
Reviews.Content: This review is probably one of the more difficult I've put up because this stay was pretty mixed. The low-down basically comes to this - the Staff is top-notch but the property needs work and its starting to run-down. This stay was a celebration of my 10th anniversary - we had held the reception here in 2000. Again the staff was great - they helped arrange a suite upgrade under my ambassador status and even supplied champagne. The lounge host even greeted me by name when I mentioned why I was there. However, the property's issues are hard to ignore. The wallpaper was peeling, the suite - a top end 'named' suite had a door with peeling paint and the 'name' had been reduced to 'Kens_ngt_n'. There are a number of other small items that could use some work. I'd probably recommend the hotel but don't expect the physical property to quite live up to the Intercontinental Name - although the staff certainly does.

Reviews.Title: “Las Bhosreenas!”
Reviews.Author: DalCowboys1001
Reviews.Content: This motel claims a bar that is open until 2am. I changed my original reservation was at another hotel; I changed it to this place because of the bar that was supposed to be open on a Saturday until 2am. I checked in at 12:30am and went to the bar and it was closed. I then tried to get on my wireless device to look for a local bar to go to. There was no wireless. I called the allstar at the desk for him to recommend a place; he recommended a gas station or the gift shop that only sold coke. No bar. No wireless. No usefull staff. No care. Beligerently pathetic excuse for a full service property.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible tragedy”
Reviews.Author: youfindmeaname
Reviews.Content: The poor experience starts when you check in. I was alone while checking in. There were two people behind the reception desk, both on their phones, one attending to a new reservation and the other on a personal call. It took exactly 25 minute to check in. No apologies were offered for the delay. The rooms are totally outdated. There is no safe in the room. The food sucks. I ordered a hamburger and spend two hours throwing it up. The gym is awful. Breakfast is served in temporary location with space enough for half the people eating there. What else can I say. FIND ANOTHER HOTEL. THIS ONE IS A HORROR STORY.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: jhporte
Reviews.Content: I have not had a more unpleasant business hotel experience ever. The hotel is undergoing major renovations, and the staff does little to help compensate for that. Where to start? 1. My room had no power from the outlets or the phone on one wall. Despite several trips downstairs (remember, no working phone), they didn't fix it all day long. Finally, I was given a new room. 2. The gym is awful. The locker rooms are under renovation, there are no towels stocked, etc. 3. Their coffee shop does not take credit cards. In addition, to bill it to your room, you have to fill out multiple paper forms (inconvenient). 4. Their bar has limited service and we had to chase down our waiter every night to pay our bill. 5. The restaurant must be under renovation also. They have a make-shift restaurant where we ate. One morning, we had 4 for breakfast and it took over an hour to get our order. 6. My bill was damaged in our copier so I called them to get a new copy. It won't be a surprise that it took multiple phone calls across a 5-day period to finally get them to send a copy to me (via email) I have stayed at ICH hotels in the past, but this is absolutely the worst one I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “4 star is a laugh!”
Reviews.Author: kym1431
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed to find a 2.5 star experience in a so called 4 star hotel! As a weekend getaway I got this room for $120 through priceline. As you enter the lobby, you will find it to be almost bare. Large "ballrooms" with outdated decor, creepy would best describe the feeling of the entry and lobby. The check in was slow, when requesting a mini fridge to keep one item in, they tried to charge an additional $15 before finally admitting the mini bar/fridge in the room would store our item. No need for an additional fridge or $15. Do not try to call the front desk, the phone rings forever and when finally answered, you will be put on hold for another very long hold. Two people at the front desk with only the nice lady working, the guy was playing on the computer and of no help at all. The room....as we quickly entered the room to drop our belongings before heading out for the night, we noticed it very hot in the room. We turned the ac on and left thinking it would be ok when we returned. Upon our return, we again turned it down cooler hoping it would cool off. Needless to say, at 5:50 am I was on the phone with the front desk telling them we were in a room with no AC!! The carpet was dirty, bed was uncomfortable and just felt like a motel. We will never stay here again, there are many options of nice, affordable and NEW places within a block ot two! I am sure they probably have working ac too!

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing experience for an ICH”
Reviews.Author: Byford1
Reviews.Content: The front line staff were generally unhelpful and haughty. There were a few exceptions but it was mostly a very negative experience. Basic room amenities--conditioner has to be requested. Mini bar restocked on request.. Poor conceirge imput--non existent --despite a request for local maps etc !!! I travel extensively and am mostly loyal to the ICH brand--this is the worst ICH experience I have had.worldwide. Houston was a completely different experience with very pleasant and helpful staff. Perhaps some staff training for those in Dallas at the front desk would be a benefit.. I felt they were doing me a favour letting me stay at their hotel It should not be like this.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice”
Reviews.Author: JMe53182
Reviews.Content: Very dingy, run down hotel. No wireless internet. Terrible shampoo/lotion, no conditioner. Overpriced food that wasn't good.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Americas labour day holiday so the place was very quiet. The pool has no changing room and no robe in the room but room service was quick to rectify this. The rooms are comfortable but the carpet was tired and stained so needs to be replaced. The staff were very friendly but too attentive and hovered too much. The ground floor is under refurbishment at present so the whole area is slightly makeshift but they are realistic about the issues. My tea pot was refilled with water but half the contents were in the saucer. Check in and check out was great. They charge for Internet. When will this stop?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaD77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the interContinental for several conferences over the last 6 years. The hotel staff is always courteous and the rooms are immaculate. The beds are also very comfortable. The hotel is not within walking distance of area attractions so you will need to rent a car or get a cab to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I only were here for one...”
Reviews.Author: PatrickH0287
Reviews.Content: My wife and I only were here for one night but the hotel was gorgeous and front desk staff were very friendly. Rooms were nice and very clean but a little small. The beds were comfortable but a bit firm for my personal tastes however the pillows were fantastic, very large and comfortable and plenty of them. The only thing that negatively affected value was the high speed Internet. The charge was about $10 for in room service, and the next day when I had to be on a conference call and wanted to take my laptop to the coffee shop downstairs wifi was an additional 10 dollars. This is pretty standard for Intercon's and most hotels of this size/type but it would be something I'd love to see changed. Overall a good stay, nice room and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyVacation
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a business trip for 3 days. Although I arrived at the hotel at 9am after an early morning flight, I was able to check in that early which was great. Everyone I encountered was friendly and the food (all meals at conference provided by hotel) was good. The slight down-sides to this hotel: - wait staff too attentive - they were like ninjas waiting to take any plate/silverware that were put down/appeared empty even for 1 second! - No ATM in the hotel even though in-room info states otherwise - Grout in bathroom tile floor was FILTHY - I was 2 doors away from elevators. While it did not "ding" each time it opened on our floor, the walls were thin enough that I could hear the motor running. Glad I wasnt right next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel soured by horrible employee”
Reviews.Author: soccermomj
Reviews.Content: I have only one horrible memory of our stay here, an employee by the name of Nabila. She apparently claims to be a manager but works in the flower shop in the lobby. Our soccer team was at the hotel for a prestigious tournament and had over 50 rooms in the hotel for our group. Another mom and I were in the lobby waiting for our team to return from a game and we had two coolers with us to pass out Gatorade and water to our team. Nabila saw us there and told us we can't stand in the lobby as there were two weddings coming. I explained what we were doing and she said we cannot be there, we had to move. I again explained that we were paying guests at the hotel and had every right to stand in the lobby waiting for our team and she then proceeded to accuse us of selling our water and Gatorade. At this point we moved closer to the elevator and a father went to speak to the front desk manager. Nabila followed him there and tried to argue with this dad and even tried to call security. The front desk manager even told her to be quiet so he could address our concerns. Not once did she apologize for her rude behavior and accusations. This type of service is unacceptable at a hotel of this price and supposed four-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel in a great location in Dallas... traveled with kids”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 2 young kids just completed a 3 night stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in Addison near the Galleria shopping mall. It was a decent experience. We mostly travel and stay in 5 star hotels but we were only in town 3 nights/4 days before heading to Lake Tahoe and San Francisco for vacation. We mainly came to go shopping and had a successful trip. We flew all night from Buenos Aires, Argentina where we lived and our flight got in very early. Fortunately they allowed us to enter one of the 2 suites that we booked. We booked 2 adjoining rooms so our young kids could sleep in there and it worked out perfectly. We were on the 8th floor and it was very quiet and we had a decent view. The basics: Valet parking is $18 and you can come and go as often as you want. I always tipped the valet guys a few bucks each time they got the car. They were very courteous and prompt in bringing my car. I called down each time before and it was always ready. Check-in was fast and courteous. I appreciated that even though both of our rooms weren't ready so early in the morning the check-in agent allowed us to enter one of the rooms as we flew 12 hours and didn't sleep on the plane. The rooms are decent. The only thing we really didn't like were the pillows which we found uncomfortable. The TV's are old and not nicer LCD tvs. Only one of the 2 rooms internet was working. They have a router that you plug in and one of them took some messing around with but worked. A real bargain at $10 a day and it's very fast. There are 6 fast elevators in the lobby so there is always one ready to go up to the rooms. We selected this hotel because of the location. Our main purpose was to do a lot of shopping so we were very close to the Galleria shopping mall, Stonebriar Mall in Frisco and our favorite Northpark was just a quick zip down the Tollway. They brought up a crib that we requested immediately after check-in and everyone was friendly. We didn't eat in the hotel at all nor get room service here as we were so busy and out and about. It's a convenient location and while not plush or too fancy, it's comfortable and the price is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: philadelphiaguy
Reviews.Content: While the lobby areas of the hotel do seem to be a little outdated, the rooms were definitely spacious and up to par and that's really what's important to me. I really liked how big the hotel felt, with tons of different public areas. I rarely stay in such large hotels so it was a great change of pace. Also, the area around here was great. It seems like a lot of hotels and business-traveler-friendly restaurants and bars thought so if local flair is really your thing, this location might not be ideal. However my colleagues and I loved it. Will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here while visiting family in the area. The room was spacious, clean and updated. The hotel is situated near major highways which made travel convenient. There was nothing really unique about the hotel, but w had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: As I read the reviews below mine, I'm not sure they were staying at the same hotel. I just spent 4 nights there with some co-workers (separate rooms) and we all loved it. I was given an upgrade to an executive-floor room (Priority Club Platinum status)--but still a 'standard' room, not a suite or anything. While the bathroom did leave a bit to be desired, the rest of the room was great--modern, clean and recently refurbished. Flat-panel TV, nice furniture. The bed was very comfortable. The internet was speedy and affordable ($9.95/day, when I'm used to paying sometimes double at other 'premium' hotels). The executive lounge had great evening snacks, albeit a small spread, but delicious hot appetizers, cheeses, fruits and veggies plus beer and wine. Breakfast was typical continental...But not bad for a no-cost upgrade at check-in. What set the Intercontinental above the rest was the staff...Everyone was so helpful and friendly. The concierge made a great dinner suggestion (Chamberlain's Seafood Market)...Great dining experience. The hotel offers a free shuttle ANYWHERE within a 3-mile radius, but I swear our restaurant the second night was further than that. We had 2 different drivers during our stay and both were SUPER guys--friendly, helpful and prompt on the pick-up after we finished at the restaurant...One night they even stopped at a bank for me to hit an ATM. I tipped them very well. The evening doorman (older gentleman) was super nice and helpful. The hotel is in a phenomenal location--tons of restaurants and shopping nearby, the shuttle isn't even necessary for some places. Our only meal in the hotel was lunch in the main restaurant, called Monte Carlo...It was pretty good. Service was good, food was fair, price was okay--not a great value, but again, not bad for a hotel. We'll definitely look at this place again when returning to Dallas. I stay at 40-50 hotels a year, at all levels of luxury, and this place lives up to the generally higher Intercontinental standards.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: justfine7890
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. The hotel was empty, deserted. Walking into the huge marble lobby there is what looks like an abandoned ballroom and an escalator that is NEVER working on the left side. The elevators - old and dirty and looks like spots on the floor. The room, again carpet and flooring old and dirty, with a olg, ugly, used and possibly never washed bedspread that I was afraid to get close to. There was one modern picture up on the wall- didn't help things, and dont call your hotel modern because you have one picture up. The alarm clock was from 1975, at best. The furniture which held the 1950's style TV had cubby holes for decor which had 3 misplaced items in them only over the whole thing. This place was just creepy and old. The only good thing is location - and these owners are milking that for all its got.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nota4StarHotel
Reviews.Content: Hotwired it for pretty cheap $59, so I can't really complain. Whenever I go to Hotwire and choose 4-star Galleria, I get either this, or the Westin Galleria. Both are supposedly 4-star. But if this is a 4-star hotel, then I am a monkey's uncle. There is just no comparison between the two hotels. Worth $59 a night, not a penny more!

Reviews.Title: “Generic, "upscale" business traveler hotel”
Reviews.Author: puzzolente
Reviews.Content: Not exactly bad but not at all memorable either, this fits perfectly into its North Tollway/Dallas environs (slight dis intended). Competent service, a sprawling marble-y lobby, slightly dated though comfortable rooms and lots of people who look like they just got out of a medical sales convention (or nearby research/focus groups, in our case). As mentioned by someone else, the lobby level is home to the worst Starbucks ever. In a word, "meh." For the money I prefer to stay a little farther down the Tollway at the Westin Galleria, which though still generic at least has some degree of soul and a multi-level mall to distract you.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob10
Reviews.Content: There was nothing exceptional or memorable about this hotel. The hotel lobby always looked deserted and the gift shop was always closed or either the doors were open with no one working inside. The sleeping rooms were average, I had problems with the hot water not being hot in the bathroom and the AC not adjusting properly. The hotel restaurant food was below average, limited options along with bad quality are not good combinations. There are several chain and local options for eating in walking distance. There is also a mall nearby, the hotel shuttle will drop you off there.

Reviews.Title: “My cell phone was stolen from my room!”
Reviews.Author: mandulka
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone downhill!The location is the only good thing left; it's close to some really amazing shops and restaurants.
